title: England's World Cup match against France at risk of being cancelled by super typhoon
text:
England and Scotland are likely to discover on Wednesday if their final World Cup pool matches will go ahead this weekend or switched to a new location amid increasing fears that a super typhoon, predicted to be one of the biggest since records began, will wreak havoc by making landfall in Tokyo and Yokohama this weekend.

The typhoon, called Hagibis, escalated on Tuesday from a tropical storm into a Category 5 super typhoon with winds estimated at 160mph, one of the most dramatic intensifications of any tropical cyclone since records began. Satellite images of the storm reveal it is around five times the size of Japan, with the eye storm reported to be around 14 miles wide.
